revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)

body.p:
how are you by this time i got your letter on saturday Saturday we are all about the same we have had very cold weather here indeed georgeGeorge came home again last saturday Saturday night he had to come to see about the property he sold to mrsMrs. stearsSteers as there is assesments assessments found against the property and Lott wrote to him to see to it immediately so he came on so much for mrMr. greenwood sGreenwood's search
and when stearsStears bought it
he had Lott to make a searsh search i gess guess they dident didn't searsh search very deep georgeGeorge went back this morning by th 7 oclock o'clock train he left it for Lott to settle against he come again it will be considerable to pay) mrsMrs. stears was here the other day she dont don't seem to get along very well her son is discharged from the water board with many others there is very many out of employment this winter georgeGeorge says any time that its conveinent convenient for you waltWalt to pay
that money you had of him he aint ain't in a hury hurry for it if you come on in febuaryFebruary that will be time enoughf enough or after that) i sent han the letter i spoke of when georgeGeorge was home before and the 5 dollar dollars he gave me for her) and to day i received one of mrMr. Heydes Heyde's epistles rather the worst one i have received yet i looked it over and threw it in the stove the most insulting but let it go)

i have not heard any thing more from matyMatty whether she is coming
or not the weather is so cold it will bee be quite an undertaking to come so far)
i am about as usual quite smart only i got up so early to get georges George's breakfast that i feel stupid enoughfenough)

closer.salute: i hope this will find you well walterWalter dear
